double_jeopardy.category: ONLY AT THE METROPOLITAN MUSEUM OF ART

clues.category: ONLY AT THE METROPOLITAN MUSEUM OF ART
clues.clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew presents from the Metropolitan Museum of Art.) Still playable, the oldest piano in existence was made in the workshop of Bartolomeo Cristofori, who invented the instrument around 1700 at the court of this ruling family of Florence

clues.category: ONLY AT THE METROPOLITAN MUSEUM OF ART
clues.clue: (Kelly of the Clue Crew presents from the Metropolitan Museum of Art.) Of the only 35 or so known paintings by this Dutch master, the Met has 5, including "Young Woman with a Water Pitcher", which was the first of his canvases to enter a public American collection

clues.category: ONLY AT THE METROPOLITAN MUSEUM OF ART
clues.clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew presents from the Metropolitan Museum of Art.) Excavated in 1900, the frescoes from an Italian villa were buried by this 79 A.D. event & beautifully preserved

clues.category: ONLY AT THE METROPOLITAN MUSEUM OF ART
clues.clue: (Kelly of the Clue Crew presents from the Metropolitan Museum of Art.)  Saved from flooding when the Aswan Dam was built, the Temple of Dendur was commissioned by Augustus, who was portrayed as a pharaoh making offerings to Osiris and this goddess, to whom the temple was primarily dedicated

clues.category: ONLY AT THE METROPOLITAN MUSEUM OF ART
clues.clue: (Kelly of the Clue Crew presents from the Metropolitan Museum of Art.) Viewers in 1884 were shocked by that dress & ridiculed her deathly pallor; when this 3-named American artist sold the painting to the Met, he asked that the woman not be named, hence the title "Madame X"

final_jeopardy.clue: In legend, he called all the animals together but only 12 came, including a rat & a dragon
